ai-mn42:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn42:2.1_0: Now at that time the brahmins and householders of Verañja were residing in Sāvatthī on some business.
ai-mn42:2.2_0: The brahmins and householders of Verañja heard:
ai-mn42:2.3_0: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—is staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn42:2.5_0: ‘He is indeed a Master, perfected and fully awakened, complete in insight and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of tamable people, teacher of gods and humans, the Master, the Buddha.
ai-mn42:2.6_0: With his own insight he has seen this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, and he makes it known to others.
ai-mn42:2.7_0: He has a Teaching that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end. It has a true goal and is well articulated. He sets out a perfectly complete and pure spiritual life.
ai-mn42:2.8_0: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”
ai-mn42:3.1_0: The brahmins and householders of Verañja went up to the Buddha.
ai-mn42:3.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-mn42:3.1_2: While the Buddha were over, they sat down to one side, and said to him:
ai-mn42:3.1_4: While they were sitting in the presence of the Buddha, they sat down to one side,
ai-mn42:3.1_5: Some of them sat down to one side,
ai-mn42:3.1_6: The brahmins and householders of Verañja said to the Buddha:
ai-mn42:4.1_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?
ai-mn42:4.2_0: And what is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
ai-mn42:5.1_0: “Unprincipled and immoral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-mn42:5.2_0: Principled and moral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-mn42:6.1_0: “We don’t understand the detailed meaning of Master Gotama’s brief statement.
ai-mn42:6.2_0: Master Gotama, please teach us this matter in detail so we can understand the meaning.”
ai-mn42:6.3_0: “Well then, householders, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn42:7.1_0: “Householders, a person of unprincipled and immoral conduct is threefold by way of body, fourfold by way of speech, and threefold by way of mind. ...” ...
ai-mn42:8.1_0: (The remainder of this discourse is identical with MN 41.)
ai-mn42:8.2_0: It’s when a certain person kills living creatures.
ai-mn42:8.2_1: A hunter who was violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.
ai-mn42:8.3_1: They covet the wealth and belongings of others ...
ai-mn42:8.4_0: They commit sexual misconduct. They have sexual relations with women who have their mother, father, both mother and father, brother, sister, relatives, or clan as guardian. They have sex with a woman who is protected on principle, or who has a husband, or whose violation is punishable by law, or even one who has been garlanded as a token of betrothal.
ai-mn42:8.5_0: This is how someone is unprincipled and immoral conduct threefold by way of body.
ai-mn42:9.1_0: And how is someone with fourfold by way of speech?
ai-mn42:9.2_0: It’s when a certain person lies in full awareness ...
ai-mn42:9.5_0: They talk nonsense. Their speech is untimely, and is neither factual nor beneficial.
ai-mn42:9.6_0: This is how someone is behaved in a principled and just manner.
ai-mn42:10.1_0: (The remainder of this discourse is identical with MN 41.)
ai-mn42:10.2_0: It’s when a certain person is covetous ...
ai-mn42:10.3_0: They have ill will and malicious intentions: ‘These beings be killed, slaughtered, and go to heaven.’
ai-mn42:10.4_0: They have wrong view. Their perspective is distorted:
ai-mn42:10.5_0: there’s no meaning in giving, etc.
ai-mn42:10.6_0: This is how one is unprincipled and immoral conduct threefold by way of mind.
ai-mn42:10.7_0: That’s how unprincipled and immoral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-mn42:11.1_0: Householders, a person of unprincipled and immoral conduct is threefold by way of body, fourfold by way of speech, and threefold by way of mind. ...” ...
ai-mn42:12.1_0: (The remainder of this discourse is identical with MN 41.)
ai-mn42:12.2_0: It’s when a certain person gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.
ai-mn42:12.4_0: They give up sexual misconduct. They don’t have sexual relations with sexual misconduct.
ai-mn42:12.5_0: This is how someone has threefold by way of body.
ai-mn42:13.1_0: And how is someone with fourfold by way of speech?
ai-mn42:13.2_0: It’s when a certain person gives up lying.
ai-mn42:13.2_2: They don’t tell a deliberate lie.
ai-mn42:13.3_0: They give up divisive speech. They repeat in one place what they heard in another so as to divide people against each other.
ai-mn42:13.6_0: This is how principled and moral conduct is fourfold by way of speech.
ai-mn42:14.1_0: (The remainder of this discourse is identical with MN 41.)
ai-mn42:14.2_0: It’s when a certain person is content.
ai-mn42:14.2_1: They don’t covet the wealth and belongings of others:
ai-mn42:14.2_2: ‘Oh, if only their belongings were mine!’
ai-mn42:14.3_0: They’re not malicious, and haven’t got all they wished:
ai-mn42:14.3_1: ‘May these sentient beings live free of enmity and ill will, untroubled and happy!’
ai-mn42:14.4_0: They have right view, an undistorted perspective:
ai-mn42:14.5_0: there is meaning in giving, etc.
ai-mn42:14.6_0: This is how one is behaved in three ways.
ai-mn42:14.7_0: This is how principled and moral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-mn42:15.2_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of well-to-do aristocrats!’
ai-mn42:15.3_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:15.5_0: That person lives in line with the teachings.
ai-mn42:16-17.2_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of well-to-do brahmins!’ ...
ai-mn42:16-17.4_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:16-17.6_0: That person lives in line with the teachings.
ai-mn42:18-42.2_0: the Gods of the Four Great Kings ...
ai-mn42:18-42.3_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.5_0: That person lives in line with the teachings.
ai-mn42:18-42.10_0: the Gods Who Love to Create ...
ai-mn42:18-42.11_0: the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others ...
ai-mn42:18-42.13_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.15_0: That person lives in line with the teachings.
ai-mn42:18-42.18_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.20_0: That person lives in line with the teachings.
ai-mn42:18-42.34_0: the gods of the dimension of infinite space ...
ai-mn42:18-42.35_0: the gods of the dimension of infinite consciousness ...
ai-mn42:18-42.36_0: the gods of the dimension of nothingness ...
ai-mn42:18-42.37_0: the gods of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
ai-mn42:18-42.38_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.40_0: That person lives in line with the teachings.
ai-mn42:43.2_0: ‘If only I might realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-mn42:43.3_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:43.5_0: That person lives in balanced finances.’”
ai-mn42:44.1_0: When he said this, the brahmins and householders of Verañja said to the Buddha:
ai-mn42:44.3_0: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, Master Gotama has made the teaching clear in many ways.
ai-mn42:44.3_1: those with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-mn42:44.3_2: just so have you made the Teaching clear in many ways.
ai-mn42:44.4_0: We go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-mn42:44.5_0: Please accept us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”
ai-mn42:44.6_0: The second section on Verañjā is finished.
